   20: -module(logger_disk_log_h_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -compile(export_all).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("kernel/include/logger.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/src/logger_internal.hrl").
   27: -include_lib("kernel/src/logger_olp.hrl").
   28: -include_lib("kernel/src/logger_h_common.hrl").
   29: -include_lib("stdlib/include/ms_transform.hrl").
   30: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -define(check_no_log, [] = test_server:messages_get()).
   33: 
   34: -define(check(Expected),
   35:         receive {log,Expected} ->
   36:                 [] = test_server:messages_get()
   37:         after 1000 ->
   38:                 ct:fail({report_not_received,
   39:                          {line,?LINE},
   40:                          {got,test_server:messages_get()}})
   41:         end).
   42: 
   43: -define(msg,"Log from "++atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++
   44:             ":"++integer_to_list(?LINE)).
   45: -define(bin(Msg), list_to_binary(Msg++"\n")).
   46: -define(log_no(File,N), lists:concat([File,".",N])).
   47: -define(domain,#{domain=>[?MODULE]}).
   48: 
   49: suite() ->
   50:     [{timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   51: 
   52: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   53:     timer:start(),                              % to avoid progress report
   54:     Config.
   55: 
   56: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   57:     ok.
   58: 
   59: init_per_group(_Group, Config) ->
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: end_per_group(_Group, _Config) ->
   63:     ok.
   64: 
   65: init_per_testcase(TestHooksCase, Config) when
   66:       TestHooksCase == write_failure;
   67:       TestHooksCase == sync_failure ->
   68:     case (fun() -> ?TEST_HOOKS_TAB == undefined end)() of
   69:         true ->
   70:             {skip,"Define the TEST_HOOKS macro to run this test"};
   71:         false ->
   72:             ct:print("********** ~w **********", [TestHooksCase]),
   73:             Config
   74:     end;
   75: init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
   76:     ct:print("********** ~w **********", [TestCase]),
   77:     Config.
   78: 
   79: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   80:     try apply(?MODULE,Case,[cleanup,Config])
   81:     catch error:undef -> ok
   82:     end,
   83:     ok.
   84: 
   85: groups() ->
   86:     [].
   87: 
   88: all() -> 
   89:     [start_stop_handler,
   90:      create_log,
   91:      open_existing_log,
   92:      disk_log_opts,
   93:      default_formatter,
   94:      logging,
   95:      filter_config,
   96:      errors,
   97:      formatter_fail,
   98:      config_fail,
   99:      bad_input,
  100:      reconfig,
  101:      sync,
  102:      disk_log_full,
  103:      disk_log_wrap,
  104:      disk_log_events,
  105:      write_failure,
  106:      sync_failure,
  107:      op_switch_to_sync,
  108:      op_switch_to_drop,
  109:      op_switch_to_flush,
  110:      limit_burst_disabled,
  111:      limit_burst_enabled_one,
  112:      limit_burst_enabled_period,
  113:      kill_disabled,
  114:      qlen_kill_new,
  115:      %% qlen_kill_std,
  116:      mem_kill_new,
  117:      %% mem_kill_std,
  118:      restart_after,
  119:      handler_requests_under_load
  120:     ].
  121: 
  122: start_stop_handler(_Config) ->
  123:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE, logger_disk_log_h, #{}),
  124:     {error,{already_exist,?MODULE}} =
  125:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE, logger_disk_log_h, #{}),
  126:     true = is_pid(whereis(h_proc_name())),
  127:     ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  128:     timer:sleep(500),
  129:     undefined = whereis(h_proc_name()).
  130: start_stop_handler(cleanup, _Config) ->
  131:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  132: 
  133: create_log(Config) ->
  134:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  135:     %% test new handler
  136:     Name1 = list_to_atom(lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_A"])),
  137:     LogFile1 = filename:join(PrivDir, Name1),
  138:     ok = start_and_add(Name1, #{filter_default=>stop,
  139:                                 filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  140:                                 formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}},
  141:                        #{file=>LogFile1}),
  142:     logger:notice("hello", ?domain),
  143:     logger_disk_log_h:filesync(Name1),
  144:     ct:pal("Checking contents of ~p", [?log_no(LogFile1,1)]),
  145:     try_read_file(?log_no(LogFile1,1), {ok,<<"hello\n">>}, 5000),
  146:     
  147:     %% test second handler
  148:     Name2 = list_to_atom(lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_B"])),
  149:     DLName = lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_B_log"]),
  150:     LogFile2 = filename:join(PrivDir, DLName),
  151:     ok = start_and_add(Name2, #{filter_default=>stop,
  152:                                 filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  153:                                 formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}},
  154:                        #{file=>LogFile2}),
  155:     logger:notice("dummy", ?domain),
  156:     logger_disk_log_h:filesync(Name2),
  157:     ct:pal("Checking contents of ~p", [?log_no(LogFile2,1)]),
  158:     try_read_file(?log_no(LogFile2,1), {ok,<<"dummy\n">>}, 5000),
  159: 
  160:     remove_and_stop(Name1),    
  161:     remove_and_stop(Name2),
  162:     try_read_file(?log_no(LogFile1,1), {ok,<<"hello\ndummy\n">>}, 1),
  163:     try_read_file(?log_no(LogFile2,1), {ok,<<"dummy\n">>}, 5000),
  164:     ok.
  165: 
  166: open_existing_log(Config) ->
  167:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  168:     %% test new handler
  169:     HName = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  170:     DLName = lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_log"]),
  171:     LogFile1 = filename:join(PrivDir, DLName),
  172:     ok = start_and_add(HName, #{filter_default=>stop,
  173:                                 filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  174:                                 formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}},
  175:                        #{file=>LogFile1}),
  176:     logger:notice("one", ?domain),
  177:     logger_disk_log_h:filesync(HName),
  178:     ct:pal("Checking contents of ~p", [?log_no(LogFile1,1)]),
  179:     try_read_file(?log_no(LogFile1,1), {ok,<<"one\n">>}, 5000),
  180:     logger:notice("two", ?domain),
  181:     ok = remove_and_stop(HName),
  182:     try_read_file(?log_no(LogFile1,1), {ok,<<"one\ntwo\n">>}, 5000),
  183: 
  184:     logger:notice("two and a half", ?domain),
  185: 
  186:     ok = start_and_add(HName, #{filter_default=>stop,
  187:                                 filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  188:                                 formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}},
  189:                        #{file=>LogFile1}),
  190:     logger:notice("three", ?domain),
  191:     logger_disk_log_h:filesync(HName),
  192:     try_read_file(?log_no(LogFile1,1), {ok,<<"one\ntwo\nthree\n">>}, 5000),
  193:     remove_and_stop(HName),
  194:     try_read_file(?log_no(LogFile1,1), {ok,<<"one\ntwo\nthree\n">>}, 5000).
  195: 
  196: disk_log_opts(Config) ->
  197:     Get = fun(Key, PL) -> proplists:get_value(Key, PL) end,
  198:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  199:     WName = list_to_atom(lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_W"])),
  200:     WFile = lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_W_log"]),
  201:     Size = length("12345"),
  202:     ConfigW = #{filter_default=>stop,
  203:                 filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  204:                 formatter => {?MODULE,no_nl}},
  205:     WFileFull = filename:join(PrivDir, WFile),
  206:     DLOptsW = #{file => WFileFull,
  207:                 type => wrap,
  208:                 max_no_bytes => Size,
  209:                 max_no_files => 2},
  210:     ok = start_and_add(WName, ConfigW, DLOptsW),
  211:     WInfo1 = disk_log:info(WName),
  212:     ct:log("Fullname = ~s", [WFileFull]),
  213:     {WFileFull,wrap,{Size,2},1} = {Get(file,WInfo1),Get(type,WInfo1),
  214:                                    Get(size,WInfo1),Get(current_file,WInfo1)},
  215:     logger:notice("123", ?domain),
  216:     logger_disk_log_h:filesync(WName),
  217:     timer:sleep(500),
  218:     1 = Get(current_file, disk_log:info(WName)),
  219: 
  220:     logger:notice("45", ?domain),
  221:     logger_disk_log_h:filesync(WName),
  222:     timer:sleep(500),
  223:     1 = Get(current_file, disk_log:info(WName)),
  224: 
  225:     logger:notice("6", ?domain),
  226:     logger_disk_log_h:filesync(WName),
  227:     timer:sleep(500),
  228:     2 = Get(current_file, disk_log:info(WName)),
  229: 
  230:     logger:notice("7890", ?domain),
  231:     logger_disk_log_h:filesync(WName),
  232:     timer:sleep(500),
  233:     2 = Get(current_file, disk_log:info(WName)),
  234: 
  235:     HName1 = list_to_atom(lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_H1"])),
  236:     HFile1 = lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_H1_log"]),
  237:     ConfigH = #{filter_default=>stop,
  238:                 filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  239:                 formatter => {?MODULE,no_nl}},
  240:     HFile1Full = filename:join(PrivDir, HFile1),
  241:     DLOptsH1 = #{file => HFile1Full,
  242:                  type => halt},
  243:     ok = start_and_add(HName1, ConfigH, DLOptsH1),
  244:     HInfo1 = disk_log:info(HName1),
  245:     ct:log("Fullname = ~s", [HFile1Full]),
  246:     {HFile1Full,halt,infinity} = {Get(file,HInfo1),Get(type,HInfo1),
  247:                                   Get(size,HInfo1)},
  248:     logger:notice("12345", ?domain),
  249:     logger_disk_log_h:filesync(HName1),
  250:     timer:sleep(500),
  251:     1 = Get(no_written_items, disk_log:info(HName1)),
  252: 
  253:     HName2 = list_to_atom(lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_H2"])),
  254:     HFile2 = lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_H2_log"]),
  255:     HFile2Full = filename:join(PrivDir, HFile2),
  256:     DLOptsH2 = DLOptsH1#{file => HFile2Full,
  257:                          max_no_bytes => 1000},
  258:     ok = start_and_add(HName2, ConfigH, DLOptsH2),
  259:     HInfo3 = disk_log:info(HName2),
  260:     ct:log("Fullname = ~s", [HFile2Full]),
  261:     {HFile2Full,halt,1000} = {Get(file,HInfo3),Get(type,HInfo3),
  262:                               Get(size,HInfo3)},
  263:     
  264:     remove_and_stop(WName),    
  265:     remove_and_stop(HName1),
  266:     remove_and_stop(HName2),    
  267:     ok.
  268: 
  269: default_formatter(Config) ->
  270:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  271:     LogFile = filename:join(PrivDir,atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
  272:     HandlerConfig = #{config => #{file=>LogFile},
  273:                       filter_default=>log},
  274:     ct:pal("Log: ~p", [LogFile]),
  275:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE, logger_disk_log_h, HandlerConfig),
  276:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,formatter,
  277:                                    {?DEFAULT_FORMATTER,?DEFAULT_FORMAT_CONFIG}),
  278:     LogName = lists:concat([LogFile, ".1"]),
  279:     logger:notice("dummy"),
  280:     wait_until_written(LogName),
  281:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(LogName),
  282:     match = re:run(Bin, "=NOTICE REPORT====.*\ndummy", [{capture,none}]),
  283:     ok.
  284: default_formatter(cleanup, _Config) ->
  285:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  286: 
  287: logging(Config) ->
  288:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  289:     %% test new handler
  290:     Name = list_to_atom(lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_1"])),
  291:     LogFile = filename:join(PrivDir, Name),
  292:     ok = start_and_add(Name, #{filter_default=>log,
  293:                                formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}},
  294:                        #{file => LogFile}),
  295:     MsgFormatter = fun(Term) -> {"Term:~p",[Term]} end,
  296:     logger:notice([{x,y}], #{report_cb => MsgFormatter}),
  297:     logger:notice([{x,y}], #{}),
  298:     ct:pal("Checking contents of ~p", [?log_no(LogFile,1)]),   
  299:     try_read_file(?log_no(LogFile,1), {ok,<<"Term:[{x,y}]\n    x: y\n">>}, 5000).
  300: 
  301: logging(cleanup, _Config) ->
  302:     Name = list_to_atom(lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_1"])),
  303:     remove_and_stop(Name).
  304: 
  305: filter_config(_Config) ->
  306:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_disk_log_h,#{}),
  307:     {ok,#{config:=HConfig}=Config} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  308:     HConfig = maps:without([olp],HConfig),
  309: 
  310:     FakeFullHConfig = HConfig#{olp=>{regname,self(),erlang:make_ref()}},
  311:     #{config:=HConfig} =
  312:         logger_disk_log_h:filter_config(Config#{config=>FakeFullHConfig}),
  313:     ok.
  314: 
  315: filter_config(cleanup,_Config) ->
  316:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  317:     ok.
  318: 
  319: errors(Config) ->
  320:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  321:     Name1 = list_to_atom(lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_1"])),
  322:     LogFile1 = filename:join(PrivDir,Name1),
  323:     HandlerConfig = #{config=>#{file=>LogFile1},
  324:                       filter_default=>log,
  325:                       formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}},
  326:     ok = logger:add_handler(Name1, logger_disk_log_h, HandlerConfig),
  327:     {error,{already_exist,Name1}} =
  328:         logger:add_handler(Name1, logger_disk_log_h, #{}),
  329:  
  330:     %%! TODO:
  331:     %%! Check how bad log_opts are handled!
  332: 
  333:     {error,{illegal_config_change,
  334:             logger_disk_log_h,
  335:             #{type:=wrap},
  336:             #{type:=halt}}} =
  337:         logger:update_handler_config(Name1,
  338:                                      config,
  339:                                      #{type=>halt,
  340:                                        file=>LogFile1}),
  341: 
  342:     {error,{illegal_config_change,
  343:             logger_disk_log_h,
  344:             #{file:=LogFile1},
  345:             #{file:="newfilename"}}} =
  346:         logger:update_handler_config(Name1,
  347:                                      config,
  348:                                      #{file=>"newfilename"}),
  349: 
  350:     %% Read-only fields may (accidentally) be included in the change,
  351:     %% but it won't take effect
  352:     {ok,C} = logger:get_handler_config(Name1),
  353:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(Name1,config,#{olp=>dummyvalue}),
  354:     {ok,C} = logger:get_handler_config(Name1),
  355: 
  356: 
  357:     ok = logger:remove_handler(Name1),
  358:     {error,{not_found,Name1}} = logger:remove_handler(Name1),
  359:     ok.
  360: 
  361: errors(cleanup, _Config) ->
  362:     Name1 = list_to_atom(lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,"_1"])),
  363:     _ = logger:remove_handler(Name1).
  364: 
  365: formatter_fail(Config) ->
  366:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  367:     Name = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  368:     LogFile = filename:join(PrivDir,Name),
  369:     ct:pal("Log = ~p", [LogFile]),
  370:     HandlerConfig = #{config => #{file=>LogFile},
  371:                       filter_default=>stop,
  372:                       filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE])},
  373:     %% no formatter!
  374:     logger:add_handler(Name, logger_disk_log_h, HandlerConfig),
  375:     Pid = whereis(h_proc_name(Name)),
  376:     true = is_pid(Pid),
  377:     H = logger:get_handler_ids(),
  378:     true = lists:member(Name,H),
  379: 
  380:     %% Formatter is added automatically
  381:     {ok,#{formatter:={logger_formatter,_}}} = logger:get_handler_config(Name),
  382:     logger:notice(M1=?msg,?domain),
  383:     Got1 = try_match_file(?log_no(LogFile,1),"[0-9\\+\\-T:\\.]* notice: "++M1,5000),
  384: 
  385:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(Name,formatter,{nonexistingmodule,#{}}),
  386:     logger:notice(M2=?msg,?domain),
  387:     Got2 = try_match_file(?log_no(LogFile,1),
  388:                           escape(Got1)++"[0-9\\+\\-T:\\.]* notice: FORMATTER CRASH: .*"++M2,
  389:                           5000),
  390: 
  391:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(Name,formatter,{?MODULE,crash}),
  392:     logger:notice(M3=?msg,?domain),
  393:     Got3 = try_match_file(?log_no(LogFile,1),
  394:                           escape(Got2)++"[0-9\\+\\-T:\\.]* notice: FORMATTER CRASH: .*"++M3,
  395:                           5000),
  396: 
  397:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(Name,formatter,{?MODULE,bad_return}),
  398:     logger:notice(?msg,?domain),
  399:     try_match_file(?log_no(LogFile,1),
  400:                    escape(Got3)++"FORMATTER ERROR: bad return value",
  401:                    5000),
  402: 
  403:     %% Check that handler is still alive and was never dead
  404:     Pid = whereis(h_proc_name(Name)),
  405:     H = logger:get_handler_ids(),
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: formatter_fail(cleanup,_Config) ->
  409:     _ = logger:remove_handler(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  410:     ok.
  411: 
  412: config_fail(_Config) ->
  413:     {error,{handler_not_added,{invalid_config,logger_disk_log_h,#{bad:=bad}}}} =
  414:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_disk_log_h,
  415:                            #{config => #{bad => bad},
  416:                              filter_default=>log,
  417:                              formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  418: 
  419:     {error,{handler_not_added,{invalid_olp_levels,#{drop_mode_qlen:=1}}}} =
  420:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_disk_log_h,
  421:                            #{config => #{drop_mode_qlen=>1}}),
  422:     {error,{handler_not_added,{invalid_olp_levels,#{sync_mode_qlen:=43,
  423:                                                 drop_mode_qlen:=42}}}} =
  424:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_disk_log_h,
  425:                            #{config => #{sync_mode_qlen=>43,
  426:                                          drop_mode_qlen=>42}}),
  427:     {error,{handler_not_added,{invalid_olp_levels,#{drop_mode_qlen:=43,
  428:                                                 flush_qlen:=42}}}} =
  429:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_disk_log_h,
  430:                            #{config => #{drop_mode_qlen=>43,
  431:                                          flush_qlen=>42}}),
  432: 
  433:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_disk_log_h,
  434:                             #{filter_default=>log,
  435:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  436:     %% can't change the disk log options for a log already in use
  437:     {error,{illegal_config_change,logger_disk_log_h,_,_}} =
  438:         logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE,config,
  439:                                      #{max_no_files=>2}),
  440:     %% incorrect values of OP params
  441:     {ok,#{config := HConfig}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  442:     {error,{invalid_olp_levels,_}} =
  443:         logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE,config,
  444:                                      HConfig#{sync_mode_qlen=>100,
  445:                                               flush_qlen=>99}),
  446:     %% invalid name of config parameter
  447:     {error,{invalid_config,logger_disk_log_h,#{filesync_rep_int:=2000}}} =
  448:         logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config,
  449:                                      HConfig#{filesync_rep_int => 2000}),
  450:     ok.
  451: config_fail(cleanup,_Config) ->
  452:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  453: 
  454: bad_input(_Config) ->
  455:     {error,{badarg,{filesync,["BadType"]}}} =
  456:         logger_disk_log_h:filesync("BadType").
  457: 
  458: reconfig(Config) ->
  459:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  460:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  461:                             logger_disk_log_h,
  462:                             #{filter_default=>log,
  463:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  464:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  465:     #{%id := ?MODULE,
  466:       sync_mode_qlen := ?SYNC_MODE_QLEN,
  467:       drop_mode_qlen := ?DROP_MODE_QLEN,
  468:       flush_qlen := ?FLUSH_QLEN,
  469:       burst_limit_enable := ?BURST_LIMIT_ENABLE,
  470:       burst_limit_max_count := ?BURST_LIMIT_MAX_COUNT,
  471:       burst_limit_window_time := ?BURST_LIMIT_WINDOW_TIME,
  472:       overload_kill_enable := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_ENABLE,
  473:       overload_kill_qlen := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_QLEN,
  474:       overload_kill_mem_size := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_MEM_SIZE,
  475:       overload_kill_restart_after := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER,
  476:       cb_state :=
  477:           #{handler_state :=
  478:                 #{log_opts := #{type := ?DISK_LOG_TYPE,
  479:                                 max_no_files := ?DISK_LOG_MAX_NO_FILES,
  480:                                 max_no_bytes := ?DISK_LOG_MAX_NO_BYTES,
  481:                                 file := DiskLogFile}},
  482:             filesync_repeat_interval := ?FILESYNC_REPEAT_INTERVAL}} =
  483:         logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
  484:     {ok,#{config :=
  485:               #{sync_mode_qlen := ?SYNC_MODE_QLEN,
  486:                 drop_mode_qlen := ?DROP_MODE_QLEN,
  487:                 flush_qlen := ?FLUSH_QLEN,
  488:                 burst_limit_enable := ?BURST_LIMIT_ENABLE,
  489:                 burst_limit_max_count := ?BURST_LIMIT_MAX_COUNT,
  490:                 burst_limit_window_time := ?BURST_LIMIT_WINDOW_TIME,
  491:                 overload_kill_enable := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_ENABLE,
  492:                 overload_kill_qlen := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_QLEN,
  493:                 overload_kill_mem_size := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_MEM_SIZE,
  494:                 overload_kill_restart_after := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER,
  495:                 filesync_repeat_interval := ?FILESYNC_REPEAT_INTERVAL,
  496:                 file := DiskLogFile,
  497:                 max_no_files := ?DISK_LOG_MAX_NO_FILES,
  498:                 max_no_bytes := ?DISK_LOG_MAX_NO_BYTES,
  499:                 type := wrap} = HConfig0}} =
  500:         logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  501: 
  502:     HConfig1 = HConfig0#{sync_mode_qlen => 1,
  503:                          drop_mode_qlen => 2,
  504:                          flush_qlen => 3,
  505:                          burst_limit_enable => false,
  506:                          burst_limit_max_count => 10,
  507:                          burst_limit_window_time => 10,
  508:                          overload_kill_enable => true,
  509:                          overload_kill_qlen => 100000,
  510:                          overload_kill_mem_size => 10000000,
  511:                          overload_kill_restart_after => infinity,
  512:                          filesync_repeat_interval => no_repeat},
  513:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE, config, HConfig1),
  514:     #{%id := ?MODULE,
  515:       sync_mode_qlen := 1,
  516:       drop_mode_qlen := 2,
  517:       flush_qlen := 3,
  518:       burst_limit_enable := false,
  519:       burst_limit_max_count := 10,
  520:       burst_limit_window_time := 10,
  521:       overload_kill_enable := true,
  522:       overload_kill_qlen := 100000,
  523:       overload_kill_mem_size := 10000000,
  524:       overload_kill_restart_after := infinity,
  525:       cb_state := #{filesync_repeat_interval := no_repeat}} =
  526:         logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
  527:     {ok,#{config:=HConfig1}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  528: 
  529:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config,
  530:                                       #{flush_qlen => ?FLUSH_QLEN}),
  531:     {ok,#{config:=C1}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  532:     ct:log("C1: ~p",[C1]),
  533:     C1 = HConfig1#{flush_qlen => ?FLUSH_QLEN},
  534: 
  535:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE, config, #{sync_mode_qlen => 1}),
  536:     {ok,#{config:=C2}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  537:     ct:log("C2: ~p",[C2]),
  538:     C2 = HConfig0#{sync_mode_qlen => 1},
  539: 
  540:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE, config, #{drop_mode_qlen => 100}),
  541:     {ok,#{config:=C3}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  542:     ct:log("C3: ~p",[C3]),
  543:     C3 = HConfig0#{drop_mode_qlen => 100},
  544: 
  545:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config, #{sync_mode_qlen => 1}),
  546:     {ok,#{config:=C4}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  547:     ct:log("C4: ~p",[C4]),
  548:     C4 = HConfig0#{sync_mode_qlen => 1,
  549:                    drop_mode_qlen => 100},
  550: 
  551:     ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  552: 
  553:     File = filename:join(Dir, "logfile"),
  554:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  555:                             logger_disk_log_h,
  556:                             #{filter_default=>log,
  557:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  558:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()},
  559:                               config=>
  560:                                   #{type => halt,
  561:                                     max_no_files => 1,
  562:                                     max_no_bytes => 1024,
  563:                                     file => File}}),
  564:     #{cb_state :=
  565:           #{handler_state :=
  566:                 #{log_opts := #{type := halt,
  567:                                 max_no_files := 1,
  568:                                 max_no_bytes := 1024,
  569:                                 file := File}}}} =
  570:         logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
  571:     {ok,#{config :=
  572:               #{type := halt,
  573:                 max_no_files := 1,
  574:                 max_no_bytes := 1024,
  575:                 file := File}=HaltHConfig} = Config2} =
  576:         logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  577: 
  578:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, level, notice),
  579:     {ok,C5} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  580:     ct:log("C5: ~p",[C5]),
  581:     C5 = Config2#{level => notice},
  582: 
  583:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE, level, info),
  584:     {ok,C6} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  585:     ct:log("C6: ~p",[C6]),
  586:     C6 = Config2#{level => info},
  587: 
  588:     %% You are not allowed to actively set the write once fields
  589:     %% (type, max_no_files, max_no_bytes, file) in runtime.
  590:     {error, {illegal_config_change,_,_,_}} =
  591:         logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{type=>wrap}),
  592:     {error, {illegal_config_change,_,_,_}} =
  593:         logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{max_no_files=>2}),
  594:     {error, {illegal_config_change,_,_,_}} =
  595:         logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{max_no_bytes=>2048}),
  596:     {error, {illegal_config_change,_,_,_}} =
  597:         logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{file=>"otherfile.log"}),
  598:     {ok,C7} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  599:     ct:log("C7: ~p",[C7]),
  600:     C7 = C6,
  601: 
  602:     %%  ... but if you don't specify the write once fields, then
  603:     %%  set_handler_config shall NOT reset them to their default value
  604:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{sync_mode_qlen=>1}),
  605:     {ok,#{config:=C8}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  606:     ct:log("C8: ~p",[C8]),
  607:     C8 = HaltHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen=>1},
  608:     ok.
  609: 
  610: reconfig(cleanup, _Config) ->
  611:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  612: 
  613: sync(Config) ->
  614:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  615:     File = filename:join(Dir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  616:     Log = lists:concat([File,".1"]),
  617:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  618:                             logger_disk_log_h,
  619:                             #{config => #{file => File},
  620:                               filter_default=>log,
  621:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  622:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,nl}}),
  623: 
  624:     start_tracer([{logger_disk_log_h,disk_log_write,3},
  625:                   {disk_log,sync,1}],
  626:                  [{logger_disk_log_h,disk_log_write,<<"first\n">>},
  627:                   {disk_log,sync}]),
  628: 
  629:     logger:notice("first", ?domain),
  630:     %% wait for automatic disk_log_sync
  631:     check_tracer(?FILESYNC_REPEAT_INTERVAL*2),
  632:     
  633:     %% check that if there's no repeated filesync active,
  634:     %% a disk_log_sync is still performed when handler goes idle
  635:     {ok,#{config := HConfig}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  636:     HConfig1 = HConfig#{filesync_repeat_interval => no_repeat},
  637:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config, HConfig1),
  638:     no_repeat = maps:get(filesync_repeat_interval,
  639:                          maps:get(cb_state,logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()))),
  640: 
  641:     start_tracer([{logger_disk_log_h,disk_log_write,3},
  642:                   {disk_log,sync,1}],
  643:                  [{logger_disk_log_h,disk_log_write,<<"second\n">>},
  644:                   {disk_log,sync},
  645:                   {logger_disk_log_h,disk_log_write,<<"third\n">>},
  646:                   {disk_log,sync}]),
  647: 
  648:     logger:notice("second", ?domain),
  649:     timer:sleep(?IDLE_DETECT_TIME*2), %% wait for automatic disk_log_sync
  650:     logger:notice("third", ?domain),
  651:     timer:sleep(?IDLE_DETECT_TIME*2), %% wait for automatic disk_log_sync
  652: 
  653:     check_tracer(1000),
  654: 
  655:     try_read_file(Log, {ok,<<"first\nsecond\nthird\n">>}, 1000),
  656: 
  657:     %% switch repeated filesync on and verify that the looping works
  658:     SyncInt = 1000,
  659:     WaitT = 4500,
  660:     OneSync = {logger_h_common,handle_info,{timeout,repeated_filesync}},
  661:     %% receive 1 repeated_filesync per sec
  662:     start_tracer([{{logger_h_common,handle_info,2},
  663:                    [{[{timeout,'_',repeated_filesync},'_'],[],[{message,{caller}}]}]}],
  664:                  [OneSync || _ <- lists:seq(1, trunc(WaitT/SyncInt))]),
  665: 
  666:     HConfig2 = HConfig#{filesync_repeat_interval => SyncInt},
  667:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config, HConfig2),
  668: 
  669:     SyncInt = maps:get(filesync_repeat_interval,
  670:                        maps:get(cb_state,logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()))),
  671:     timer:sleep(WaitT),
  672:     HConfig3 = HConfig#{filesync_repeat_interval => no_repeat},
  673:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config, HConfig3),
  674:     check_tracer(100),
  675:     ok.
  676: sync(cleanup,_Config) ->
  677:     dbg:stop(),
  678:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  679: 
  680: disk_log_wrap(Config) ->
  681:     Get = fun(Key, PL) -> proplists:get_value(Key, PL) end,
  682:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  683:     File = filename:join(Dir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  684:     ct:pal("Log = ~p", [File]),
  685:     MaxFiles = 3,
  686:     MaxBytes = 5,
  687:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  688:                             logger_disk_log_h,
  689:                             #{filter_default=>log,
  690:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  691:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()},
  692:                               config=>
  693:                                   #{type => wrap,
  694:                                     max_no_files => MaxFiles,
  695:                                     max_no_bytes => MaxBytes,
  696:                                     file => File}}),
  697:     Info = disk_log:info(?MODULE),
  698:     {File,wrap,{MaxBytes,MaxFiles},1} =
  699:         {Get(file,Info),Get(type,Info),Get(size,Info),Get(current_file,Info)},
  700:     Tester = self(),
  701:     TraceFun = fun({trace,_,call,{Mod,Func,Details}}, Pid) ->
  702:                        Pid ! {trace,Mod,Func,Details},
  703:                        Pid
  704:                end,
  705:     {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(process, {TraceFun, Tester}),
  706:     {ok,_} = dbg:p(whereis(h_proc_name()), [c]),
  707:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp(logger_disk_log_h, handle_info, 3, []),
  708: 
  709:     Text = [34 + rand:uniform(126-34) || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxBytes)],
  710:     ct:pal("String = ~p (~w)", [Text, erts_debug:size(Text)]),
  711:     %% fill first file
  712:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
  713:                           Log = lists:concat([File,".",N]),
  714:                           logger:notice(Text, ?domain),
  715:                           wait_until_written(Log),
  716:                           ct:pal("N = ~w",
  717:                                  [N = Get(current_file,
  718:                                           disk_log:info(?MODULE))])
  719:                   end, lists:seq(1,MaxFiles)),
  720: 
  721:     %% wait for trace messages
  722:     timer:sleep(1000),
  723:     dbg:stop(),
  724:     Received = lists:flatmap(fun({trace,_M,handle_info,
  725:                                   [_,{disk_log,_Node,_Name,What},_]}) ->
  726:                                      [{trace,What}];
  727:                                 ({log,_}) ->
  728:                                      []
  729:                              end, test_server:messages_get()),
  730:     ct:pal("Trace =~n~p", [Received]),
  731:     Received = [{trace,{wrap,0}} || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxFiles-1)],
  732:     ok.
  733: 
  734: disk_log_wrap(cleanup,_Config) ->
  735:     dbg:stop(),
  736:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  737: 
  738: disk_log_full(Config) ->
  739:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  740:     File = filename:join(Dir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  741:     ct:pal("Log = ~p", [File]),
  742:     MaxBytes = 50,
  743:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  744:                             logger_disk_log_h,
  745:                             #{filter_default=>log,
  746:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  747:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()},
  748:                               config=>
  749:                                   #{type => halt,
  750:                                     max_no_files => 1,
  751:                                     max_no_bytes => MaxBytes,
  752:                                     file => File}}),
  753: 
  754:     Tester = self(),
  755:     TraceFun = fun({trace,_,call,{Mod,Func,Details}}, Pid) ->
  756:                        Pid ! {trace,Mod,Func,Details},
  757:                        Pid
  758:                end,
  759:     {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(process, {TraceFun, Tester}),
  760:     {ok,_} = dbg:p(whereis(h_proc_name()), [c]),
  761:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp(logger_disk_log_h, handle_info, 3, []),
  762: 
  763:     NoOfChars = 5,
  764:     Text = [34 + rand:uniform(126-34) || _ <- lists:seq(1,NoOfChars)],
  765:     [logger:notice(Text, ?domain) || _ <- lists:seq(1,trunc(MaxBytes/NoOfChars)+1)],
  766: 
  767:     %% wait for trace messages
  768:     timer:sleep(2000),
  769:     dbg:stop(),
  770:     Received = lists:flatmap(fun({trace,_M,handle_info,
  771:                                   [_,{disk_log,_Node,_Name,What},_]}) ->
  772:                                      [{trace,What}];
  773:                                 ({log,_}) ->
  774:                                      []
  775:                              end, test_server:messages_get()),
  776:     ct:pal("Trace =~n~p", [Received]),
  777: 
  778:     %% The tail here could be an error_status notification, if the
  779:     %% last write was synchronous, but in most cases it will not be
  780:     [{trace,full}|_] = Received,
  781:     %% [{trace,full},
  782:     %%  {trace,{error_status,{error,{full,_}}}}] = Received,
  783:     ok.
  784: disk_log_full(cleanup, _Config) ->
  785:     dbg:stop(),
  786:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).    
  787: 
  788: disk_log_events(_Config) ->
  789:     Node = node(),
  790:     Log = ?MODULE,
  791:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  792:                             logger_disk_log_h,
  793:                             #{filter_default=>log,
  794:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  795:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  796: 
  797:     %% Events copied from disk_log API
  798:     Events =
  799:         [{disk_log, Node, Log, {wrap, 0}},
  800:          {disk_log, Node, Log, {truncated, 0}},
  801:          {disk_log, Node, Log, {read_only, 42}},
  802:          {disk_log, Node, Log, {blocked_log, 42}},
  803:          {disk_log, Node, Log, {format_external, 42}},
  804:          {disk_log, Node, Log, full},
  805:          {disk_log, Node, Log, {error_status, ok}}],
  806:     
  807:     Tester = self(),
  808:     TraceFun = fun({trace,_,call,{Mod,Func,Details}}, Pid) ->
  809:                        Pid ! {trace,Mod,Func,Details},
  810:                        Pid
  811:                end,
  812:     {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(process, {TraceFun, Tester}),
  813:     {ok,_} = dbg:p(whereis(h_proc_name()), [c]),
  814:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp(logger_disk_log_h, handle_info, 3, []),
  815:     
  816:     [whereis(h_proc_name()) ! E || E <- Events],
  817:     %% wait for trace messages
  818:     timer:sleep(2000),
  819:     dbg:stop(),
  820:     Received = lists:map(fun({trace,_M,handle_info,
  821:                               [_,Got,_]}) -> Got
  822:                          end, test_server:messages_get()),
  823:     ct:pal("Trace =~n~p", [Received]),
  824:     NoOfEvents = length(Events),
  825:     NoOfEvents = length(Received),
  826:     lists:foreach(fun(Event) ->
  827:                           true = lists:member(Event, Received)
  828:                   end, Received),
  829:     ok.
  830: disk_log_events(cleanup, _Config) ->
  831:     dbg:stop(),
  832:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).    
  833: 
  834: write_failure(Config) ->
  835:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  836:     File = filename:join(Dir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  837:     Log = lists:concat([File,".1"]),
  838:     ct:pal("Log = ~p", [Log]),
  839: 
  840:     Node = start_h_on_new_node(Config, File),
  841:     false = (undefined == rpc:call(Node, ets, whereis, [?TEST_HOOKS_TAB])),
  842:     rpc:call(Node, ets, insert, [?TEST_HOOKS_TAB,{tester,self()}]),
  843:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_internal_log, [?MODULE,internal_log]),
  844:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [disk_log_write,ok]),
  845:     HState = rpc:call(Node, logger_olp, info, [h_proc_name(?STANDARD_HANDLER)]),
  846:     LogOpts = maps:get(log_opts,
  847:                        maps:get(handler_state,
  848:                                 maps:get(cb_state,HState))),
  849:     ct:pal("LogOpts = ~p", [LogOpts]),
  850:            
  851:     %% ?check and ?check_no_log in this test only check for internal log events
  852:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Logged1"),
  853:     rpc:call(Node, logger_disk_log_h, filesync, [?STANDARD_HANDLER]),
  854:     ?check_no_log, % no internal log when write ok
  855: 
  856:     SyncRepInt = case (fun() -> is_atom(?FILESYNC_REPEAT_INTERVAL) end)() of
  857:                      true -> 5500;
  858:                      false -> ?FILESYNC_REPEAT_INTERVAL + 500
  859:                  end,
  860: 
  861:     try_read_file(Log, {ok,<<"Logged1\n">>}, SyncRepInt),
  862: 
  863:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [disk_log_write,{error,no_such_log}]),
  864:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Cause simple error printout"),
  865: 
  866:     %% this should have caused an internal log
  867:     ?check({error,{?STANDARD_HANDLER,log,LogOpts,{error,no_such_log}}}),
  868: 
  869:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "No second error printout"),
  870:     ?check_no_log, % but don't log same error twice
  871: 
  872:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [disk_log_write,
  873:                                          {error,{full,?STANDARD_HANDLER}}]),
  874:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Cause simple error printout"),
  875:     %% this was a different error, so it should be logged
  876:     ?check({error,{?STANDARD_HANDLER,log,LogOpts,
  877:                    {error,{full,?STANDARD_HANDLER}}}}),
  878: 
  879:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [disk_log_write,ok]),
  880:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Logged2"),
  881:     rpc:call(Node, logger_disk_log_h, filesync, [?STANDARD_HANDLER]),
  882:     ?check_no_log, % no internal log when write ok
  883:     try_read_file(Log, {ok,<<"Logged1\nLogged2\n">>}, SyncRepInt),
  884:     ok.
  885: write_failure(cleanup, _Config) ->
  886:     Nodes = nodes(),
  887:     [test_server:stop_node(Node) || Node <- Nodes].
  888: 
  889: 
  890: sync_failure(Config) ->
  891:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  892:     FileName = lists:concat([?MODULE,"_",?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  893:     File = filename:join(Dir, FileName),
  894: 
  895: 
  896:     Node = start_h_on_new_node(Config, File),
  897:     false = (undefined == rpc:call(Node, ets, whereis, [?TEST_HOOKS_TAB])),
  898:     rpc:call(Node, ets, insert, [?TEST_HOOKS_TAB,{tester,self()}]),
  899:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_internal_log, [?MODULE,internal_log]),
  900:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [disk_log_sync,ok]),
  901:     HState = rpc:call(Node, logger_olp, info, [h_proc_name(?STANDARD_HANDLER)]),
  902:     LogOpts = maps:get(log_opts, maps:get(handler_state,
  903:                                           maps:get(cb_state,HState))),
  904:     
  905:     SyncInt = 500,
  906:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, update_handler_config,
  907:                   [?STANDARD_HANDLER, config,
  908:                    #{filesync_repeat_interval => SyncInt}]),
  909:     Info = rpc:call(Node, logger_olp, info, [h_proc_name(?STANDARD_HANDLER)]),
  910:     SyncInt = maps:get(filesync_repeat_interval, maps:get(cb_state, Info)),
  911:     
  912:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Logged1"),
  913:     ?check_no_log,
  914: 
  915:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [disk_log_sync,{error,no_such_log}]),
  916:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Cause simple error printout"),
  917:     
  918:     ?check({error,{?STANDARD_HANDLER,filesync,LogOpts,{error,no_such_log}}}),
  919: 
  920:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "No second error printout"),
  921:     ?check_no_log,
  922: 
  923:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result,
  924:              [disk_log_sync,{error,{blocked_log,?STANDARD_HANDLER}}]),
  925:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Cause simple error printout"),
  926:     ?check({error,{?STANDARD_HANDLER,filesync,LogOpts,
  927:                    {error,{blocked_log,?STANDARD_HANDLER}}}}),
  928: 
  929:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [disk_log_sync,ok]),
  930:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Logged2"),
  931:     ?check_no_log,
  932:     ok.
  933: sync_failure(cleanup, _Config) ->
  934:     Nodes = nodes(),
  935:     [test_server:stop_node(Node) || Node <- Nodes].
  936: 
  937: start_h_on_new_node(Config, File) ->
  938:     {ok,_,Node} =
  939:         logger_test_lib:setup(
  940:           Config,
  941:           [{logger,[{handler,default,logger_disk_log_h,
  942:                      #{ config => #{ file => File }}}]}]),
  943:     ok = rpc:call(Node,logger,set_handler_config,[?STANDARD_HANDLER,formatter,
  944:                                                   {?MODULE,nl}]),
  945:     Node.
  946: 
  947: log_on_remote_node(Node,Msg) ->
  948:     _ = spawn_link(Node,
  949:                    fun() -> erlang:group_leader(whereis(user),self()),
  950:                             logger:notice(Msg)
  951:                    end),
  952:     ok.
  953: 
  954: %% functions for test hook macros to be called by rpc
  955: set_internal_log(_Mod, _Func) ->
  956:     ?set_internal_log({_Mod,_Func}).
  957: set_result(_Op, _Result) ->
  958:     ?set_result(_Op, _Result).
  959: set_defaults() ->
  960:     ?set_defaults().
  961: 
  962: %% internal log function that sends the term to the test case process
  963: internal_log(Type, Term) ->
  964:     [{tester,Tester}] = ets:lookup(?TEST_HOOKS_TAB, tester),
  965:     Tester ! {log,{Type,Term}},
  966:     logger:internal_log(Type, Term),
  967:     ok.
  968: 
  969: 
  970: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  971: %%% Overload protection tests
  972: 
  973: op_switch_to_sync(Config) ->
  974:     {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
  975:     NumOfReqs = 500,
  976:     NewHConfig =
  977:         HConfig#{config => DLHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 2,
  978:                                       drop_mode_qlen => NumOfReqs+1,
  979:                                       flush_qlen => 2*NumOfReqs,
  980:                                       burst_limit_enable => false}},
  981:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
  982:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
  983:     Lines = count_lines(Log),
  984:     NumOfReqs = Lines,
  985:     ok = file_delete(Log),
  986:     ok.
  987: op_switch_to_sync(cleanup, _Config) ->
  988:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
  989: 
  990: op_switch_to_drop() ->
  991:     [{timetrap,{seconds,180}}].
  992: op_switch_to_drop(Config) ->
  993:     Test =
  994:         fun() ->
  995:                 {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} =
  996:                     start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
  997:                 NumOfReqs = 300,
  998:                 Procs = 2,
  999:                 Bursts = 10,
 1000:                 NewHConfig =
 1001:                     HConfig#{config =>
 1002:                                  DLHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 1,
 1003:                                             drop_mode_qlen => 2,
 1004:                                             flush_qlen => Procs*NumOfReqs*Bursts,
 1005:                                             burst_limit_enable => false}},
 1006:                 ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1007:                 %% It sometimes happens that the handler either gets
 1008:                 %% the requests in a slow enough pace so that dropping
 1009:                 %% never occurs. Therefore, lets generate a number of
 1010:                 %% bursts to increase the chance of message buildup.
 1011:                 [send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, {spawn,Procs,0}, {chars,79}, notice) ||
 1012:                     _ <- lists:seq(1, Bursts)],
 1013:                 Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1014:                 ok = stop_handler(?MODULE),
 1015:                 ct:pal("Number of messages dropped = ~w (~w)",
 1016:                        [Procs*NumOfReqs*Bursts-Logged,Procs*NumOfReqs*Bursts]),
 1017:                 true = (Logged < (Procs*NumOfReqs*Bursts)),
 1018:                 true = (Logged > 0),
 1019:                 _ = file_delete(Log),
 1020:                 ok
 1021:         end,
 1022:     %% As it's tricky to get the timing right in only one go, we perform the
 1023:     %% test repeatedly, hoping that will generate a successful result.
 1024:     case repeat_until_ok(Test, 10) of
 1025:         {ok,{Failures,_Result}} ->
 1026:             ct:log("Failed ~w times before success!", [Failures]);
 1027:         {fails,Reason} ->
 1028:             ct:fail(Reason)
 1029:     end.    
 1030: op_switch_to_drop(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1031:     _  = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1032: 
 1033: op_switch_to_flush() ->
 1034:     [{timetrap,{minutes,3}}].
 1035: op_switch_to_flush(Config) ->
 1036:     Test =
 1037:         fun() ->
 1038:                 {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} =
 1039:                     start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1040:                 
 1041:                 %% NOTE: it's important that both async and sync
 1042:                 %% requests have been queued when the flush happens
 1043:                 %% (verify with coverage of flush_log_requests/2)
 1044:     
 1045:                 NewHConfig =
 1046:                     HConfig#{config =>
 1047:                                  DLHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 2,
 1048:                                             %% disable drop mode
 1049:                                             drop_mode_qlen => 300,
 1050:                                             flush_qlen => 300,
 1051:                                             burst_limit_enable => false}},    
 1052:                 ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1053:                 NumOfReqs = 10000,
 1054:                 Procs = 10,
 1055:                 Bursts = 10,
 1056:                 %% It sometimes happens that the handler either gets
 1057:                 %% the requests in a slow enough pace so that flushing
 1058:                 %% never occurs, or it gets all messages at once,
 1059:                 %% causing all messages to get flushed (no dropping of
 1060:                 %% sync messages gets tested). Therefore, lets
 1061:                 %% generate a number of bursts to increase the chance
 1062:                 %% of message buildup in some random fashion.
 1063:                 [send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, {spawn,Procs,0}, {chars,79}, notice) ||
 1064:                     _ <- lists:seq(1,Bursts)],
 1065:                 Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1066:                 ok= stop_handler(?MODULE),
 1067:                 ct:pal("Number of messages flushed/dropped = ~w (~w)",
 1068:                        [NumOfReqs*Procs*Bursts-Logged,NumOfReqs*Procs*Bursts]),
 1069:                 true = (Logged < (NumOfReqs*Procs*Bursts)),
 1070:                 true = (Logged > 0),
 1071:                 _ = file_delete(Log),
 1072:                 ok
 1073:         end,
 1074:     %% As it's tricky to get the timing right in only one go, we perform the
 1075:     %% test repeatedly, hoping that will generate a successful result.
 1076:     case repeat_until_ok(Test, 10) of
 1077:         {ok,{Failures,_Result}} ->
 1078:             ct:log("Failed ~w times before success!", [Failures]);
 1079:         {fails,Reason} ->
 1080:             ct:fail(Reason)
 1081:     end.
 1082: op_switch_to_flush(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1083:     _  = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1084: 
 1085: 
 1086: limit_burst_disabled(Config) ->
 1087:     {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1088:     NewHConfig =
 1089:         HConfig#{config => DLHConfig#{burst_limit_enable => false,
 1090:                                       burst_limit_max_count => 10,
 1091:                                       burst_limit_window_time => 2000,
 1092:                                       drop_mode_qlen => 200,
 1093:                                       flush_qlen => 300}},
 1094:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1095:     NumOfReqs = 100,
 1096:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1097:     Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1098:     ct:pal("Number of messages logged = ~w", [Logged]),
 1099:     NumOfReqs = Logged,
 1100:     ok = file_delete(Log),
 1101:     ok.
 1102: limit_burst_disabled(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1103:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1104: 
 1105: limit_burst_enabled_one(Config) ->
 1106:     {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1107:     ReqLimit = 10,
 1108:     NewHConfig =
 1109:         HConfig#{config => DLHConfig#{burst_limit_enable => true,
 1110:                                       burst_limit_max_count => ReqLimit,
 1111:                                       burst_limit_window_time => 2000,
 1112:                                       drop_mode_qlen => 200,
 1113:                                       flush_qlen => 300}},
 1114:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1115:     NumOfReqs = 100,
 1116:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1117:     Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1118:     ct:pal("Number of messages logged = ~w", [Logged]),
 1119:     ReqLimit = Logged,
 1120:     ok = file_delete(Log),
 1121:     ok.
 1122: limit_burst_enabled_one(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1123:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1124: 
 1125: limit_burst_enabled_period(Config) ->
 1126:     {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1127:     ReqLimit = 10,
 1128:     BurstTWin = 1000,
 1129:     NewHConfig =
 1130:         HConfig#{config => DLHConfig#{burst_limit_enable => true,
 1131:                                       burst_limit_max_count => ReqLimit,
 1132:                                       burst_limit_window_time => BurstTWin,
 1133:                                       drop_mode_qlen => 20000,
 1134:                                       flush_qlen => 20001}},
 1135:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1136:     
 1137:     Windows = 3,
 1138:     Sent = send_burst({t,BurstTWin*Windows}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1139:     Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1140:     ct:pal("Number of messages sent = ~w~nNumber of messages logged = ~w",
 1141:            [Sent,Logged]),
 1142:     true = (Logged > (ReqLimit*Windows)) andalso
 1143:            (Logged < (ReqLimit*(Windows+2))),
 1144:     ok = file_delete(Log),
 1145:     ok.
 1146: limit_burst_enabled_period(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1147:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1148: 
 1149: kill_disabled(Config) ->
 1150:     {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1151:     NewHConfig =
 1152:         HConfig#{config=>DLHConfig#{overload_kill_enable=>false,
 1153:                                     overload_kill_qlen=>10,
 1154:                                     overload_kill_mem_size=>100}},
 1155:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1156:     NumOfReqs = 100,
 1157:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1158:     Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1159:     ct:pal("Number of messages logged = ~w", [Logged]),
 1160:     ok = file_delete(Log),
 1161:     true = is_pid(whereis(h_proc_name())),
 1162:     ok.
 1163: kill_disabled(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1164:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1165: 
 1166: qlen_kill_new(Config) ->
 1167:     {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1168:     Pid0 = whereis(h_proc_name()),
 1169:     {_,Mem0} = process_info(Pid0, memory),
 1170:     RestartAfter = ?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER,
 1171:     NewHConfig =
 1172:         HConfig#{config =>
 1173:                      DLHConfig#{burst_limit_enable=>false,
 1174:                                 overload_kill_enable=>true,
 1175:                                 overload_kill_qlen=>10,
 1176:                                 overload_kill_mem_size=>Mem0+50000,
 1177:                                 overload_kill_restart_after=>RestartAfter}},
 1178:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1179:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid0),
 1180:     NumOfReqs = 5000,
 1181:     Procs = 4,
 1182:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, {spawn,Procs,0}, {chars,79}, notice),
 1183:     %% send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1184:     receive
 1185:         {'DOWN', MRef, _, _, Info} ->
 1186:            case Info of
 1187:                 {shutdown,{overloaded,QLen,Mem}} ->
 1188:                     ct:pal("Terminated with qlen = ~w, mem = ~w", [QLen,Mem]);
 1189:                 killed ->
 1190:                     ct:pal("Slow shutdown, handler process was killed!", [])
 1191:             end,
 1192:             file_delete(Log),
 1193:             {ok,_} = wait_for_process_up(RestartAfter * 3),
 1194:             ok
 1195:     after
 1196:         5000 ->
 1197:             Info = logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
 1198:             ct:pal("Handler state = ~p", [Info]),
 1199:             ct:fail("Handler not dead! It should not have survived this!")
 1200:     end.
 1201: qlen_kill_new(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1202:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1203: 
 1204: mem_kill_new(Config) ->
 1205:     {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1206:     Pid0 = whereis(h_proc_name()),
 1207:     {_,Mem0} = process_info(Pid0, memory),
 1208:     RestartAfter = ?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER,
 1209:     NewHConfig =
 1210:         HConfig#{config =>
 1211:                      DLHConfig#{overload_kill_enable=>true,
 1212:                                 overload_kill_qlen=>50000,
 1213:                                 overload_kill_mem_size=>Mem0+500,
 1214:                                 overload_kill_restart_after=>RestartAfter}},
 1215:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1216:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid0),
 1217:     NumOfReqs = 500,
 1218:     Procs = 4,
 1219:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, {spawn,Procs,0}, {chars,79}, notice),
 1220:     %% send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1221:     receive
 1222:         {'DOWN', MRef, _, _, Info} ->
 1223:             case Info of
 1224:                 {shutdown,{overloaded,QLen,Mem}} ->
 1225:                     ct:pal("Terminated with qlen = ~w, mem = ~w", [QLen,Mem]);
 1226:                 killed ->
 1227:                     ct:pal("Slow shutdown, handler process was killed!", [])
 1228:             end,
 1229:             file_delete(Log),
 1230:             {ok,_} = wait_for_process_up(RestartAfter * 3),
 1231:             ok
 1232:     after
 1233:         5000 ->
 1234:             Info = logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
 1235:             ct:pal("Handler state = ~p", [Info]),
 1236:             ct:fail("Handler not dead! It should not have survived this!")
 1237:     end.
 1238: mem_kill_new(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1239:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1240: 
 1241: restart_after() ->
 1242:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
 1243: restart_after(Config) ->
 1244:     {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1245:     NewHConfig1 =
 1246:         HConfig#{config=>DLHConfig#{overload_kill_enable=>true,
 1247:                                     overload_kill_qlen=>4,
 1248:                                     overload_kill_restart_after=>infinity}},
 1249:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig1),
 1250:     MRef1 = erlang:monitor(process, whereis(h_proc_name())),
 1251:     %% kill handler
 1252:     send_burst({n,1000}, {spawn,5,0}, {chars,79}, notice),
 1253:     receive
 1254:         {'DOWN', MRef1, _, _, _Reason1} ->
 1255:             file_delete(Log),
 1256:             error = wait_for_process_up(?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER * 3),
 1257:             ok
 1258:     after
 1259:         5000 ->
 1260:             Info1 = logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
 1261:             ct:pal("Handler state = ~p", [Info1]),
 1262:             ct:fail("Handler not dead! It should not have survived this!")
 1263:     end,
 1264:     
 1265:     {Log,_,_} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1266:     RestartAfter = ?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER,
 1267:     NewHConfig2 =
 1268:         HConfig#{config=>DLHConfig#{overload_kill_enable=>true,
 1269:                                     overload_kill_qlen=>4,
 1270:                                     overload_kill_restart_after=>RestartAfter}},
 1271:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig2),
 1272:     Pid0 = whereis(h_proc_name()),
 1273:     MRef2 = erlang:monitor(process, Pid0),
 1274:     %% kill handler
 1275:     send_burst({n,500}, {spawn,5,0}, {chars,79}, notice),
 1276:     receive
 1277:         {'DOWN', MRef2, _, _, _Reason2} ->
 1278:             file_delete(Log),
 1279:             {ok,Pid1} = wait_for_process_up(RestartAfter * 3),
 1280:             false = (Pid1 == Pid0),
 1281:             ok
 1282:     after
 1283:         5000 ->
 1284:             Info2 = logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
 1285:             ct:pal("Handler state = ~p", [Info2]),
 1286:             ct:fail("Handler not dead! It should not have survived this!")
 1287:     end,
 1288:     ok.
 1289: restart_after(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1290:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1291: 
 1292: %% send handler requests (sync, info, reset, change_config)
 1293: %% during high load to verify that sync, dropping and flushing is
 1294: %% handled correctly.
 1295: handler_requests_under_load() ->
 1296:     [{timetrap,{minutes,5}}].
 1297: handler_requests_under_load(Config) ->
 1298:     {Log,HConfig,DLHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1299:     NewHConfig =
 1300:         HConfig#{config => DLHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 2,
 1301:                                       drop_mode_qlen => 1000,
 1302:                                       flush_qlen => 2000,
 1303:                                       burst_limit_enable => false}},
 1304:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1305:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1306:             fun() -> send_requests(1,[{logger_disk_log_h,filesync,[?MODULE],[]},
 1307:                                       {logger_olp,info,[h_proc_name()],[]},
 1308:                                       {logger_olp,reset,[h_proc_name()],[]},
 1309:                                       {logger,update_handler_config,
 1310:                                        [?MODULE, config,
 1311:                                         #{overload_kill_enable => false}],
 1312:                                        []}])
 1313:             end),
 1314:     Procs = 100,
 1315:     Sent = Procs * send_burst({n,5000}, {spawn,Procs,10}, {chars,79}, notice),
 1316:     Pid ! {self(),finish},
 1317:     ReqResult = receive {Pid,Result} -> Result end,
 1318:     Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1319:     ct:pal("Number of messages sent = ~w~nNumber of messages logged = ~w",
 1320:            [Sent,Logged]),
 1321:     FindError = fun(Res) ->
 1322:                         [E || E <- Res,
 1323:                               is_tuple(E) andalso (element(1,E) == error)]
 1324:                 end,
 1325:     Errors = [{Func,FindError(Res)} || {_,Func,_,Res} <- ReqResult],
 1326:     NoOfReqs = lists:foldl(fun({_,_,_,Res}, N) -> N + length(Res) end,
 1327:                            0, ReqResult),
 1328:     ct:pal("~w requests made. Errors: ~n~p", [NoOfReqs,Errors]),
 1329:     ok = file_delete(Log).
 1330: handler_requests_under_load(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1331:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1332: 
 1333: send_requests(TO, Reqs = [{Mod,Func,Args,Res}|Rs]) ->
 1334:     receive
 1335:         {From,finish} ->
 1336:             From ! {self(),Reqs}
 1337:     after
 1338:         TO ->
 1339:             Result = apply(Mod,Func,Args),
 1340:             send_requests(TO, Rs ++ [{Mod,Func,Args,[Result|Res]}])
 1341:     end.
 1342: 
 1343: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1344: %%% 
 1345: start_handler(Name, FuncName, Config) ->
 1346:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
 1347:     File = filename:join(Dir, FuncName),
 1348:     ct:pal("Logging to ~tp", [File]),
 1349:     FullFile = lists:concat([File,".1"]),
 1350:     _ = file_delete(FullFile),
 1351:     ok = logger:add_handler(Name,
 1352:                             logger_disk_log_h,
 1353:                             #{config=>#{file => File,
 1354:                                         max_no_files => 1,
 1355:                                         max_no_bytes => 100000000},
 1356:                               filter_default=>log,
 1357:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([Name]),
 1358:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,op}}),
 1359:     {ok,HConfig = #{config := DLHConfig}} = logger:get_handler_config(Name),
 1360:     {FullFile,HConfig,DLHConfig}.
 1361:     
 1362: stop_handler(Name) ->
 1363:     ct:pal("Stopping handler ~p!", [Name]),
 1364:     Res = logger:remove_handler(Name),
 1365:     RegName = ?name_to_reg_name(logger_disk_log_h, Name),
 1366:     erlang:monitor(process, RegName),
 1367:     receive
 1368:         {'DOWN',_,_,_,_} ->
 1369:             Res
 1370:     after 5000 ->
 1371:             %% If the removal fails, we make sure that it is removed
 1372:             %% so that the next testcase is not effected.
 1373:             exit(whereis(RegName), kill),
 1374:             receive
 1375:                 {'DOWN',_,_,_,_} ->
 1376:                     %% We fail this testcase in order to catch any bugs
 1377:                     %% in shutdown
 1378:                     ct:fail("Failed to stop handler")
 1379:             end
 1380:     end.
 1381: 
 1382: send_burst(NorT, Type, {chars,Sz}, Class) ->
 1383:     Text = [34 + rand:uniform(126-34) || _ <- lists:seq(1,Sz)],
 1384:     case NorT of
 1385:         {n,N} ->
 1386:             %% process_flag(priority, high),
 1387:             send_n_burst(N, Type, Text, Class),
 1388:             %% process_flag(priority, normal),
 1389:             N;
 1390:         {t,T} ->
 1391:             ct:pal("Sending messages sequentially for ~w ms", [T]),
 1392:             T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1393:             send_t_burst(T0, T, Text, Class, 0)
 1394:     end.
 1395: 
 1396: send_n_burst(0, _, _Text, _Class) ->
 1397:     ok;
 1398: send_n_burst(N, seq, Text, Class) ->
 1399:     ok = logger:Class(Text, ?domain),
 1400:     send_n_burst(N-1, seq, Text, Class);
 1401: send_n_burst(N, {spawn,Ps,TO}, Text, Class) ->
 1402:     ct:pal("~w processes each sending ~w messages", [Ps,N]),
 1403:     MRefs = [begin if TO == 0 -> ok; true -> timer:sleep(TO) end,
 1404:                    monitor(process,spawn_link(per_proc_fun(N,Text,Class,X)))
 1405:              end || X <- lists:seq(1,Ps)],
 1406:     lists:foreach(fun(MRef) ->
 1407:                           receive
 1408:                               {'DOWN', MRef, _, _, _} ->
 1409:                                   ok
 1410:                           end
 1411:                   end, MRefs),
 1412:     ct:pal("Message burst sent", []),
 1413:     ok.
 1414: 
 1415: send_t_burst(T0, T, Text, Class, N) ->
 1416:     T1 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1417:     if (T1-T0) > T ->
 1418:             N;
 1419:        true ->
 1420:             ok = logger:Class(Text, ?domain),
 1421:             send_t_burst(T0, T, Text, Class, N+1)
 1422:     end.
 1423: 
 1424: per_proc_fun(N,Text,Class,X) when X rem 2 == 0 ->
 1425:     fun() ->
 1426:             process_flag(priority,high),
 1427:             send_n_burst(N, seq, Text, Class)
 1428:     end;
 1429: per_proc_fun(N,Text,Class,_) ->
 1430:     fun() ->
 1431:             send_n_burst(N, seq, Text, Class)
 1432:     end.
 1433: 
 1434: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1435: %%% Formatter callback
 1436: %%% Using this to send the formatted string back to the test case
 1437: %%% process - so it can check for logged events.
 1438: format(_,bad_return) ->
 1439:     bad_return;
 1440: format(_,crash) ->
 1441:     erlang:error(formatter_crashed);
 1442: format(#{msg:={report,R},meta:=#{report_cb:=Fun}}=Log,Config) ->
 1443:     format(Log#{msg=>Fun(R)},Config);
 1444: format(#{msg:={string,String0}},no_nl) ->
 1445:     String = unicode:characters_to_list(String0),
 1446:     String;
 1447: format(#{msg:={string,String0}},nl) ->
 1448:     String = unicode:characters_to_list(String0),
 1449:     String++"\n";
 1450: format(#{msg:={string,String0}},op) ->
 1451:     String = unicode:characters_to_list(String0),
 1452:     String++"\n";
 1453: format(#{msg:={report,#{label:={supervisor,progress}}}},op) ->
 1454:     "";
 1455: format(#{msg:={report,#{label:={gen_server,terminate}}}},op) ->
 1456:     "";
 1457: format(#{msg:={report,#{label:={proc_lib,crash}}}},op) ->
 1458:     "";
 1459: format(#{msg:={F,A}},OpOrPid) when is_list(F), is_list(A) ->
 1460:     String = lists:flatten(io_lib:format(F,A)),
 1461:     if is_pid(OpOrPid) -> OpOrPid ! {log,String};
 1462:        true -> ok
 1463:     end,
 1464:     String++"\n";
 1465: format(#{msg:={string,String0}},Pid) ->
 1466:     String = unicode:characters_to_list(String0),
 1467:     Pid ! {log,String},
 1468:     String++"\n";
 1469: format(Msg,Tag) ->
 1470:     Error = {unexpected_format,Msg,Tag},
 1471:     erlang:display(Error),
 1472:     exit(Error).
 1473: 
 1474: start_and_add(Name, Config, LogOpts) ->
 1475:     HConfig = maps:get(config, Config, #{}),
 1476:     HConfig1 = maps:merge(HConfig, LogOpts),
 1477:     Config1 = Config#{config=>HConfig1},
 1478:     ct:pal("Adding handler ~w with: ~p", [Name,Config1]),
 1479:     ok = logger:add_handler(Name, logger_disk_log_h, Config1),
 1480:     Pid = whereis(h_proc_name(Name)),
 1481:     true = is_pid(Pid),
 1482:     Name = proplists:get_value(name, disk_log:info(Name)),
 1483:     ok.
 1484:  
 1485: remove_and_stop(Handler) ->
 1486:     ok = logger:remove_handler(Handler),
 1487:     timer:sleep(500),
 1488:     undefined = whereis(h_proc_name(Handler)),
 1489:     ok.
 1490: 
 1491: try_read_file(FileName, Expected, Time) ->
 1492:     try_read_file(FileName, Expected, Time, undefined).
 1493: 
 1494: try_read_file(FileName, Expected, Time, _) when Time > 0 ->
 1495:     case file:read_file(FileName) of
 1496:         Expected ->
 1497:             ok;
 1498:         Error = {error,_Reason} ->
 1499:             erlang:error(Error);
 1500:         SomethingElse ->
 1501:             ct:pal("try_read_file read unexpected: ~p~n", [SomethingElse]),
 1502:             timer:sleep(500),
 1503:             try_read_file(FileName, Expected, Time-500, SomethingElse)
 1504:     end;
 1505: 
 1506: try_read_file(_, _, _, Incorrect) ->
 1507:     ct:pal("try_read_file got incorrect pattern: ~p~n", [Incorrect]),
 1508:     erlang:error({error,not_matching_pattern,Incorrect}).
 1509: 
 1510: try_match_file(FileName, Pattern, Time) ->
 1511:     try_match_file(FileName, Pattern, Time, <<>>).
 1512: 
 1513: try_match_file(FileName, Pattern, Time, _) when Time > 0 ->
 1514:     case file:read_file(FileName) of
 1515:         {ok, Bin} ->
 1516:             case re:run(Bin,Pattern,[{capture,none}]) of
 1517:                 match ->
 1518:                     unicode:characters_to_list(Bin);
 1519:                 _ ->
 1520:                     timer:sleep(100),
 1521:                     try_match_file(FileName, Pattern, Time-100, Bin)
 1522:             end;
 1523:         Error ->
 1524:             erlang:error(Error)
 1525:     end;
 1526: try_match_file(_,Pattern,_,Incorrect) ->
 1527:     ct:pal("try_match_file did not match pattern: ~p~nGot: ~p~n",
 1528:            [Pattern,Incorrect]),
 1529:     erlang:error({error,not_matching_pattern,Pattern,Incorrect}).
 1530: 
 1531: count_lines(File) ->
 1532:     wait_until_written(File),
 1533:     count_lines1(File).
 1534: 
 1535: wait_until_written(File) ->
 1536:     wait_until_written(File, -1).
 1537: 
 1538: wait_until_written(File, Sz) ->
 1539:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1540:     case file:read_file_info(File) of
 1541:         {ok,#file_info{size = Sz}} ->
 1542:             timer:sleep(1000),
 1543:             case file:read_file_info(File) of
 1544:                 {ok,#file_info{size = Sz}} ->
 1545:                     ok;
 1546:                 {ok,#file_info{size = Sz1}} ->
 1547:                     wait_until_written(File, Sz1)
 1548:             end;
 1549:         {ok,#file_info{size = Sz1}} ->
 1550:             wait_until_written(File, Sz1)
 1551:     end.
 1552:     
 1553: count_lines1(File) ->
 1554:     {_,Dev} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1555:     Lines = count_lines2(Dev, 0),
 1556:     file:close(Dev),
 1557:     Lines.
 1558: 
 1559: count_lines2(Dev, LC) ->
 1560:     case file:read_line(Dev) of
 1561:         {ok,"Handler logger_disk_log_h_SUITE " ++_} ->
 1562:             %% Not counting handler info
 1563:             count_lines2(Dev,LC);
 1564:         {ok,_} ->
 1565:             count_lines2(Dev,LC+1);
 1566:         eof -> LC
 1567:     end.
 1568: 
 1569: repeat_until_ok(Fun, N) ->
 1570:     repeat_until_ok(Fun, 0, N, undefined).
 1571: 
 1572: repeat_until_ok(_Fun, Stop, Stop, Reason) ->
 1573:     {fails,Reason};
 1574: 
 1575: repeat_until_ok(Fun, C, Stop, FirstReason) ->
 1576:     if C > 0 -> timer:sleep(5000);
 1577:        true -> ok
 1578:     end,
 1579:     try Fun() of
 1580:         Result ->
 1581:             {ok,{C,Result}}
 1582:     catch
 1583:         _:Reason:Stack ->
 1584:             ct:pal("Test fails: ~p (~p)~n", [Reason,hd(Stack)]),
 1585:             if FirstReason == undefined ->
 1586:                     repeat_until_ok(Fun, C+1, Stop, {Reason,Stack});
 1587:                true ->
 1588:                     repeat_until_ok(Fun, C+1, Stop, FirstReason)
 1589:             end
 1590:     end.
 1591: 
 1592: start_tracer(Trace,Expected) ->
 1593:     Pid = self(),
 1594:     dbg:tracer(process,{fun tracer/2,{Pid,Expected}}),
 1595:     dbg:p(h_proc_name(),[c]),
 1596:     tpl(Trace),
 1597:     ok.
 1598: 
 1599: tpl([{M,F,A}|Trace]) ->
 1600:     tpl([{{M,F,A},c}|Trace]);
 1601: tpl([{{M,F,A},MS}|Trace]) ->
 1602:     {ok,Match} = dbg:tpl(M,F,A,MS),
 1603:     case lists:keyfind(matched,1,Match) of
 1604:         {_,_,1} ->
 1605:             ok;
 1606:         _ ->
 1607:             dbg:stop(),
 1608:             throw({skip,"Can't trace "++atom_to_list(M)++":"++
 1609:                        atom_to_list(F)++"/"++integer_to_list(A)})
 1610:     end,
 1611:     tpl(Trace);
 1612: tpl([]) ->
 1613:     ok.
 1614: 
 1615: tracer({trace,_,call,{logger_h_common = Mod,handle_cast = Func,[Op|_]},Caller},
 1616:        {Pid,[{Mod,Func,Op}|Expected]}) ->
 1617:     maybe_tracer_done(Pid,Expected,{Mod,Func,Op},Caller);
 1618: tracer({trace,_,call,{Mod=logger_disk_log_h,Func=disk_log_write,[_,_,Data]},Caller}, {Pid,[{Mod,Func,Data}|Expected]}) ->
 1619:     maybe_tracer_done(Pid,Expected,{Mod,Func,Data},Caller);
 1620: tracer({trace,_,call,{Mod,Func,_},Caller}, {Pid,[{Mod,Func}|Expected]}) ->
 1621:     maybe_tracer_done(Pid,Expected,{Mod,Func},Caller);
 1622: tracer({trace,_,call,{logger_h_common = Mod,handle_info = Func,[{timeout,_,Op},_S]},Caller},
 1623:        {Pid,[{Mod,Func,{timeout,Op}}|Expected]}) ->
 1624:     maybe_tracer_done(Pid,Expected,{Mod,Func},Caller);
 1625: tracer({trace,_,call,Call,Caller}, {Pid,Expected}) ->
 1626:     ct:log("Tracer got unexpected: ~p~nCaller: ~p~nExpected: ~p~n",[Call,Caller,Expected]),
 1627:     Pid ! {tracer_got_unexpected,Call,Expected},
 1628:     {Pid,Expected}.
 1629: 
 1630: maybe_tracer_done(Pid,[],Got,Caller) ->
 1631:     ct:log("Tracer got: ~p~nCaller: ~p~n",[Got,Caller]),
 1632:     Pid ! tracer_done;
 1633: maybe_tracer_done(Pid,Expected,Got,Caller) ->
 1634:     ct:log("Tracer got: ~p~nCaller: ~p~n",[Got,Caller]),
 1635:     {Pid,Expected}.
 1636: 
 1637: check_tracer(T) ->
 1638:     receive
 1639:         tracer_done ->
 1640:             dbg:stop(),
 1641:             ok;
 1642:         {tracer_got_unexpected,Got,Expected} ->
 1643:             dbg:stop(),
 1644:             ct:fail({tracer_got_unexpected,Got,Expected})
 1645:     after T ->
 1646:             dbg:stop(),
 1647:             ct:fail({timeout,tracer})
 1648:     end.
 1649: 
 1650: escape([$+|Rest]) ->
 1651:     [$\\,$+|escape(Rest)];
 1652: escape([H|T]) ->
 1653:     [H|escape(T)];
 1654: escape([]) ->
 1655:     [].
 1656: 
 1657: h_proc_name() ->
 1658:     h_proc_name(?MODULE).
 1659: h_proc_name(Name) ->
 1660:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([logger_disk_log_h,"_",Name])).
 1661: 
 1662: wait_for_process_up(T) ->
 1663:     wait_for_process_up(?MODULE, h_proc_name(), T).
 1664: 
 1665: wait_for_process_up(Name, RegName, T) ->
 1666:     N = (T div 500) + 1,
 1667:     wait_for_process_up1(Name, RegName, N).
 1668: 
 1669: wait_for_process_up1(_Name, _RegName, 0) ->
 1670:     error;
 1671: wait_for_process_up1(Name, RegName, N) ->
 1672:     timer:sleep(500),
 1673:     case whereis(RegName) of
 1674:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1675:             case logger:get_handler_config(Name) of
 1676:                 {ok,_} ->
 1677:                     %% ct:pal("Process ~p up (~p tries left)",[Name,N]),
 1678:                     {ok,Pid};
 1679:                 _ ->
 1680:                     wait_for_process_up1(Name, RegName, N-1)
 1681:             end;
 1682:         undefined ->
 1683:             %% ct:pal("Waiting for process ~p (~p tries left)",[Name,N]),
 1684:             wait_for_process_up1(Name, RegName, N-1)
 1685:     end.
 1686: 
 1687: file_delete(Log) ->
 1688:    file:delete(Log).
